result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher M. Skinner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Christopher M. Skinner in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives sentencing recommendation for each case.  State moves to dismiss all charges on this matter.  Court orders and dismisses.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher M. Skinner
Current: 430 LaValle Street, Reedsburg, WI 53959 United States  (Effective: 09-24-2015)
Prior: 850 Plum Street, #a208, Reedsburg, WI 53959

Attorney Puck Tsai in court.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tsai gives status.  Matter to resolve.  Bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Puck Tsai in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE in custody in Juneau Co.  Cases will have resolution, 30 day reset.  Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
no contact w/viking village foods in Reedsburg

Pre-trial conference at 07-31-2015 11:00 am.
Return date at 08-12-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Christopher M. Skinner appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Puck Tsai. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller and intern Rick S. appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint. State requests $300.00 Cash bond.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Atty. Tsai makes bail argument, not needed for cash bond.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $500 Signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/Viking Foods in Reedsburg.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 11:00 am.  Return date scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
